channel.title: Boolean process() { ...grrr!
channel.description: The point is... I'm trying to delete public boolean process so my server won't lag... the problem is I don't know what to do with the stuff in the process. All of this is to make it so when I mass click on things - training objects etc. - it won't lag. Whenever I mass click on them right now it lags, meaning if I click somewhere else while I'm training on an object, there's a major delay. Can someone please tell me how to take care of the process()?

item.title: Boolean process() { ...grrr!
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

A few people told me to add timers yeah, um action timers don’t really help at all…

Read full topic

item.title: Boolean process() { ...grrr!
item.dc:creator: @dev_eXer dev eXer
item.description:
@dev_eXer wrote:

LeScape Pk:

LMFAO. No cookie for you. deleting process destroys your server. ever tried actiontimers?

Oh my you make me laugh so much. Please next time think before talking. Actiontimers?

LOL

Read full topic

item.title: Boolean process() { ...grrr!
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

or you could if someone mass clicks discard their packets maybe? not all packets have to be handled useless ones that are spent by spammers/massers should be rejected…

I haven’t coded any rs2 server and I dont really care about RS2 but it looks like you have no delay checks to the imcoming packets

Read full topic

item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

hehe, the prob is everything of client is handled by process()
so delete that and you have no client.

delete some things in it, (useless)
or redirect them to voids/other booleans
